dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S2649 IS: To provide certain legal relief from politically motivated charges by the Government of Egypt.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Graham (for himself, Mrs. Shaheen, Mr. Kirk, Mr. Kaine, and Mr. McCain) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: To provide certain legal relief from politically motivated charges by the Government of Egypt.

section.header: Relief from politically motivated charges by Government of Egypt

subsection.header: Treatment of charges under United States law
subsection.text: For purposes of United States law, and for activities undertaken within the jurisdiction of the United States, no verdict, order, warrant, or writ issued by the Government of Egypt or any court, administrative tribunal, or other authority of the Government of Egypt in any instance relating to the legal charges, trial proceedings, and convictions issued by the Cairo Criminal Court on June 4, 2013, in Public Prosecution Case No. 1110 for the Year 2012 against 43 staff of five international nongovernmental organizations shall be considered a conviction and no person named in such verdict, order, warrant, or writ shall be considered to have been charged, accused, found guilty, or convicted.

subsection.header: Recognition of charges as politically motivated
subsection.text: It is the policy of the United States to recognize any legal charges, trial proceedings, and convictions issued by the Cairo Criminal Court on June 4, 2013, in Public Prosecution Case No. 1110 for the Year 2012 as being politically motivated in origin and invalid.
